content: crochet linen scarf designed by heidi beukelman materials 3 skeins claudia hand painted yarns fingering colorway oops or any fingering weight yarn approximately 475 yds without fringe 500 yds with fringe hook size e 3 5 mm scissors tapestry needle measurements without fringe = 4 5 x 61 with fringe = 4 5 x 72 this measurement is dependent on the trimmed fringe length gauge this scarf is designed to mimic the knit linen stitch with the perk that 6 stitches and 7 row in pattern = 1 inch it s double sided and is a lot quicker to work up it is worked lengthwise with fringe added at the end if desired variegated yarn is recommended but solid colors can be used to created an alternating abbreviations pattern of stripes single_crochet = single_crochet chain = chain note the yardage amount given is a close approximation less or space = space more yardage can be used to make a shorter/narrower or longer/ wider scarf if changing the length of the scarf make sure to have an even number in the base chain note if it looks like there will be pooling of colors try working every few row or every other row with a second skein or the inside and outside of the ball for personal use only please do not reproduce without permission heidijoh on ravelry crochet linen scarf 2 pattern leaving an 7 tail chain 400 row 1 single_crochet in 3rd chain from hook ch1 skip 1 chain single_crochet to end turn row 2 chain 2 single_crochet in 1st ch1 space ch1 single_crochet in next ch1 space until 1 single_crochet and fringe the chain 2 space remain ch1 single_crochet in chain 2 space turn repeat row 2 until scarf measures 4 5 wide if not adding fringe weave in ends for fringe cut about 72 lengths of yarn 14 long create the fringe tassels by using a tapestry needle and 2 precut lengths of yarn note a good way to ensure evenly space them along the end making sure to tie snug knots see that your fringe is even is to sidebar incorporate ends and tail into tassels sample pictured has 18 use a quilting mat and rotary tassels per each end trim tassels to uniform length sample ended up cutter with 5 5 fringe the scarf is now ready to wear -- no blocking necessary for personal use only please do not reproduce without permission heidijoh on ravelry
